speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER

scene: SCENE III.  London. The palace.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: To bear our fortunes in our own strong arms,

scene: SCENE III.  London. The palace.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Which now we hold at much uncertainty.

scene: SCENE III.  London. The palace.

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: LADY PERCY
line: O, my good lord, why are you thus alone?

speaker: LADY PERCY
line: Why dost thou bend thine eyes upon the earth,

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: LADY PERCY

scene: SCENE III.  Warkworth castle
speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

line: I fear my brother Mortimer doth stir

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: LADY PERCY

speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Away,

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

speaker: HOTSPUR

line: Welcome, Jack: where hast thou been?

line: A plague of all cowards, I say, and a vengeance too!

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: marry, and amen! Give me a cup of sack, boy. Ere I

line: die when thou wilt, if manhood, good manhood, be

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

line: grows old: God help the while! a bad world, I say.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: thing. A plague of all cowards, I say still.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

line: subjects afore thee like a flock of wild-geese,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

line: Why, you whoreson round man, what's the matter?

line: could run as fast as thou canst. You are straight

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: drunk to-day.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: drunkest last.

speaker: FALSTAFF

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: A plague of all cowards, still say I.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What's the matter?

line: Where is it, Jack? where is it?

line: What, a hundred, man?

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I am a rogue, if I were not at half-sword with a

speaker: FALSTAFF

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

speaker: FALSTAFF

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: POINS
line: Ay, ay, he said four.

speaker: FALSTAFF
line: me. I made me no more ado but took all their seven

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: points in my target, thus.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: In buckram?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Prithee, let him alone; we shall have more anon.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Dost thou hear me, Hal?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Ay, and mark thee too, Jack.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Do so, for it is worth the listening to. These nine

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: in buckram that I told thee of--

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: So, two more already.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Their points being broken,--

speaker: POINS
line: Down fell their hose.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Began to give me ground: but I followed me close,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: came in foot and hand; and with a thought seven of

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the eleven I paid.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O monstrous! eleven buckram men grown out of two!

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: But, as the devil would have it, three misbegotten

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: knaves in Kendal green came at my back and let drive

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: at me; for it was so dark, Hal, that thou couldst

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: not see thy hand.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: These lies are like their father that begets them;

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: gross as a mountain, open, palpable. Why, thou

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: clay-brained guts, thou knotty-pated fool, thou

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: whoreson, obscene, grease tallow-catch,--

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: What, art thou mad? art thou mad? is not the truth

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the truth?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Why, how couldst thou know these men in Kendal

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: green, when it was so dark thou couldst not see thy

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

line: hand? come, tell us your reason: what sayest thou to this?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: POINS
line: Come, your reason, Jack, your reason.

speaker: FALSTAFF

line: strappado, or all the racks in the world, I would

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

line: compulsion! If reasons were as plentiful as

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

line: blackberries, I would give no man a reason upon

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: compulsion, I.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I'll be no longer guilty of this sin; this sanguine

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: coward, this bed-presser, this horseback-breaker,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: this huge hill of flesh,--

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: 'Sblood, you starveling, you elf-skin, you dried

line: when thou hast tired thyself in base comparisons,

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: hear me speak but this.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: POINS
line: Mark, Jack.

speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: We two saw you four set on four and bound them, and

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.

line: were masters of their wealth. Mark now, how a plain

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Dost thou speak like a king? Do thou stand for me,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: and I'll play my father.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Depose me? if thou dost it half so gravely, so

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: majestically, both in word and matter, hang me up by

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the heels for a rabbit-sucker or a poulter's hare.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Well, here I am set.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: And here I stand: judge, my masters.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Now, Harry, whence come you?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My noble lord, from Eastcheap.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The complaints I hear of thee are grievous.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: 'Sblood, my lord, they are false: nay, I'll tickle

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: ye for a young prince, i' faith.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Swearest thou, ungracious boy? henceforth ne'er look

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: on me. Thou art violently carried away from grace:

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: there is a devil haunts thee in the likeness of an

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: old fat man; a tun of man is thy companion. Why

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: dost thou converse with that trunk of humours, that

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: bolting-hutch of beastliness, that swollen parcel

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: of dropsies, that huge bombard of sack, that stuffed

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: cloak-bag of guts, that roasted Manningtree ox with

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: the pudding in his belly, that reverend vice, that

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: grey iniquity, that father ruffian, that vanity in

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: years? Wherein is he good, but to taste sack and

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: drink it? wherein neat and cleanly, but to carve a

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: capon and eat it? wherein cunning, but in craft?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: wherein crafty, but in villany? wherein villanous,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: but in all things? wherein worthy, but in nothing?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I would your grace would take me with you: whom

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: means your grace?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That villanous abominable misleader of youth,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Falstaff, that old white-bearded Satan.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: My lord, the man I know.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I know thou dost.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: But to say I know more harm in him than in myself,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: were to say more than I know. That he is old, the

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: more the pity, his white hairs do witness it; but

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: that he is, saving your reverence, a whoremaster,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: that I utterly deny. If sack and sugar be a fault,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: God help the wicked! if to be old and merry be a

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: sin, then many an old host that I know is damned: if

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: to be fat be to be hated, then Pharaoh's lean kine

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: are to be loved. No, my good lord; banish Peto,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: banish Bardolph, banish Poins: but for sweet Jack

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Falstaff, kind Jack Falstaff, true Jack Falstaff,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: valiant Jack Falstaff, and therefore more valiant,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: being, as he is, old Jack Falstaff, banish not him

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: thy Harry's company, banish not him thy Harry's

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: company: banish plump Jack, and banish all the world.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I do, I will.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: O, my lord, my lord! the sheriff with a most

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: BARDOLPH
line: monstrous watch is at the door.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Out, ye rogue! Play out the play: I have much to

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: say in the behalf of that Falstaff.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Hostess
line: O Jesu, my lord, my lord!

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Heigh, heigh! the devil rides upon a fiddlestick:

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: what's the matter?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Hostess
line: The sheriff and all the watch are at the door: they

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Hostess
line: are come to search the house. Shall I let them in?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Dost thou hear, Hal? never call a true piece of

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: gold a counterfeit: thou art essentially mad,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: without seeming so.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And thou a natural coward, without instinct.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I deny your major: if you will deny the sheriff,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: so; if not, let him enter: if I become not a cart

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: as well as another man, a plague on my bringing up!

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I hope I shall as soon be strangled with a halter as another.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Go, hide thee behind the arras: the rest walk up

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: above. Now, my masters, for a true face and good

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: conscience.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Both which I have had: but their date is out, and

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: therefore I'll hide me.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Call in the sheriff.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Now, master sheriff, what is your will with me?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: First, pardon me, my lord. A hue and cry

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: Hath follow'd certain men unto this house.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What men?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: One of them is well known, my gracious lord,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: A gross fat man.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Carrier
line: As fat as butter.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The man, I do assure you, is not here;

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: For I myself at this time have employ'd him.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And, sheriff, I will engage my word to thee

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That I will, by to-morrow dinner-time,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Send him to answer thee, or any man,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: For any thing he shall be charged withal:

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And so let me entreat you leave the house.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: I will, my lord. There are two gentlemen

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: Have in this robbery lost three hundred marks.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: It may be so: if he have robb'd these men,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: He shall be answerable; and so farewell.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: Good night, my noble lord.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I think it is good morrow, is it not?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: Sheriff
line: Indeed, my lord, I think it be two o'clock.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This oily rascal is known as well as Paul's. Go,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: call him forth.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Falstaff!--Fast asleep behind the arras, and

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: snorting like a horse.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Hark, how hard he fetches breath. Search his pockets.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What hast thou found?

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Nothing but papers, my lord.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Let's see what they be: read them.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Reads  Item, A capon,. . 2s. 2d.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Item, Sauce,. . . 4d.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Item, Sack, two gallons, 5s. 8d.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Item, Anchovies and sack after supper, 2s. 6d.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Item, Bread,        ob.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O monstrous! but one half-penny-worth of bread to

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: this intolerable deal of sack! What there is else,

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: keep close; we'll read it at more advantage: there

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: let him sleep till day. I'll to the court in the

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: morning. We must all to the wars, and thy place

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: shall be honourable. I'll procure this fat rogue a

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: charge of foot; and I know his death will be a

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: march of twelve-score. The money shall be paid

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: back again with advantage. Be with me betimes in

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: the morning; and so, good morrow, Peto.

scene: SCENE IV.  The Boar's-Head Tavern, Eastcheap.
speaker: PETO
line: Good morrow, good my lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: These promises are fair, the parties sure,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: And our induction full of prosperous hope.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Lord Mortimer, and cousin Glendower,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Will you sit down?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And uncle Worcester: a plague upon it!

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I have forgot the map.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: No, here it is.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Sit, cousin Percy; sit, good cousin Hotspur,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: For by that name as oft as Lancaster

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Doth speak of you, his cheek looks pale and with

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: A rising sigh he wisheth you in heaven.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And you in hell, as oft as he hears Owen Glendower spoke of.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I cannot blame him: at my nativity

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Of burning cressets; and at my birth

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The frame and huge foundation of the earth

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Shaked like a coward.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Why, so it would have done at the same season, if

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: your mother's cat had but kittened, though yourself

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: had never been born.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I say the earth did shake when I was born.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And I say the earth was not of my mind,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: If you suppose as fearing you it shook.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The heavens were all on fire, the earth did tremble.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: O, then the earth shook to see the heavens on fire,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And not in fear of your nativity.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Diseased nature oftentimes breaks forth

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: In strange eruptions; oft the teeming earth

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Is with a kind of colic pinch'd and vex'd

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: By the imprisoning of unruly wind

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Within her womb; which, for enlargement striving,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Shakes the old beldam earth and topples down

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Steeples and moss-grown towers. At your birth

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Our grandam earth, having this distemperature,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: In passion shook.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Cousin, of many men

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I do not bear these crossings. Give me leave

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: To tell you once again that at my birth

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The front of heaven was full of fiery shapes,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The goats ran from the mountains, and the herds

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Were strangely clamorous to the frighted fields.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: These signs have mark'd me extraordinary;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And all the courses of my life do show

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I am not in the roll of common men.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Where is he living, clipp'd in with the sea

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: That chides the banks of England, Scotland, Wales,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Which calls me pupil, or hath read to me?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And bring him out that is but woman's son

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Can trace me in the tedious ways of art

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And hold me pace in deep experiments.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I think there's no man speaks better Welsh.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I'll to dinner.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Peace, cousin Percy; you will make him mad.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I can call spirits from the vasty deep.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Why, so can I, or so can any man;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: But will they come when you do call for them?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Why, I can teach you, cousin, to command

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The devil.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And I can teach thee, coz, to shame the devil

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: By telling truth: tell truth and shame the devil.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: If thou have power to raise him, bring him hither,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And I'll be sworn I have power to shame him hence.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: O, while you live, tell truth and shame the devil!

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Come, come, no more of this unprofitable chat.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Three times hath Henry Bolingbroke made head

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Against my power; thrice from the banks of Wye

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And sandy-bottom'd Severn have I sent him

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Bootless home and weather-beaten back.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Home without boots, and in foul weather too!

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: How 'scapes he agues, in the devil's name?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Come, here's the map: shall we divide our right

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: According to our threefold order ta'en?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: The archdeacon hath divided it

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Into three limits very equally:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: England, from Trent and Severn hitherto,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: By south and east is to my part assign'd:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: All westward, Wales beyond the Severn shore,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: And all the fertile land within that bound,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: To Owen Glendower: and, dear coz, to you

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: The remnant northward, lying off from Trent.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: And our indentures tripartite are drawn;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Which being sealed interchangeably,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: A business that this night may execute,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: To-morrow, cousin Percy, you and I

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: And my good Lord of Worcester will set forth

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: To meet your father and the Scottish power,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: As is appointed us, at Shrewsbury.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: My father Glendower is not ready yet,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Not shall we need his help these fourteen days.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Within that space you may have drawn together

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Your tenants, friends and neighbouring gentlemen.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: A shorter time shall send me to you, lords:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And in my conduct shall your ladies come;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: From whom you now must steal and take no leave,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: For there will be a world of water shed

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Upon the parting of your wives and you.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Methinks my moiety, north from Burton here,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: In quantity equals not one of yours:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: See how this river comes me cranking in,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And cuts me from the best of all my land

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: A huge half-moon, a monstrous cantle out.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I'll have the current in this place damm'd up;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And here the smug and silver Trent shall run

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: In a new channel, fair and evenly;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: It shall not wind with such a deep indent,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: To rob me of so rich a bottom here.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Not wind? it shall, it must; you see it doth.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Yea, but

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Mark how he bears his course, and runs me up

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: With like advantage on the other side;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Gelding the opposed continent as much

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: As on the other side it takes from you.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Yea, but a little charge will trench him here

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And on this north side win this cape of land;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And then he runs straight and even.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I'll have it so: a little charge will do it.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I'll not have it alter'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Will not you?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: No, nor you shall not.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Who shall say me nay?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Why, that will I.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Let me not understand you, then; speak it in Welsh.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I can speak English, lord, as well as you;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: For I was train'd up in the English court;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Where, being but young, I framed to the harp

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Many an English ditty lovely well

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And gave the tongue a helpful ornament,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: A virtue that was never seen in you.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Marry,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And I am glad of it with all my heart:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I had rather be a kitten and cry mew

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Than one of these same metre ballad-mongers;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I had rather hear a brazen canstick turn'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Or a dry wheel grate on the axle-tree;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And that would set my teeth nothing on edge,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Nothing so much as mincing poetry:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: 'Tis like the forced gait of a shuffling nag.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Come, you shall have Trent turn'd.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I do not care: I'll give thrice so much land

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: To any well-deserving friend;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: But in the way of bargain, mark ye me,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I'll cavil on the ninth part of a hair.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Are the indentures drawn? shall we be gone?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The moon shines fair; you may away by night:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I'll haste the writer and withal

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Break with your wives of your departure hence:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: I am afraid my daughter will run mad,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: So much she doteth on her Mortimer.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Fie, cousin Percy! how you cross my father!

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I cannot choose: sometime he angers me

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: With telling me of the mouldwarp and the ant,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Of the dreamer Merlin and his prophecies,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And of a dragon and a finless fish,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: A clip-wing'd griffin and a moulten raven,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: A couching lion and a ramping cat,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And such a deal of skimble-skamble stuff

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: As puts me from my faith. I tell you what;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: He held me last night at least nine hours

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: In reckoning up the several devils' names

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: That were his lackeys: I cried 'hum,' and 'well, go to,'

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: But mark'd him not a word. O, he is as tedious

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: As a tired horse, a railing wife;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Worse than a smoky house: I had rather live

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: With cheese and garlic in a windmill, far,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Than feed on cates and have him talk to me

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: In any summer-house in Christendom.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: In faith, he is a worthy gentleman,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Exceedingly well read, and profited

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: In strange concealments, valiant as a lion

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: And as wondrous affable and as bountiful

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: As mines of India. Shall I tell you, cousin?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: He holds your temper in a high respect

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: And curbs himself even of his natural scope

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: When you come 'cross his humour; faith, he does:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: I warrant you, that man is not alive

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Might so have tempted him as you have done,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Without the taste of danger and reproof:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: But do not use it oft, let me entreat you.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: In faith, my lord, you are too wilful-blame;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And since your coming hither have done enough

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: To put him quite beside his patience.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: You must needs learn, lord, to amend this fault:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Though sometimes it show greatness, courage, blood,--

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And that's the dearest grace it renders you,--

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Yet oftentimes it doth present harsh rage,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Defect of manners, want of government,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Pride, haughtiness, opinion and disdain:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The least of which haunting a nobleman

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Loseth men's hearts and leaves behind a stain

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Upon the beauty of all parts besides,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Beguiling them of commendation.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Well, I am school'd: good manners be your speed!

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Here come our wives, and let us take our leave.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: This is the deadly spite that angers me;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: My wife can speak no English, I no Welsh.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: My daughter weeps: she will not part with you;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: She'll be a soldier too, she'll to the wars.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Good father, tell her that she and my aunt Percy

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Shall follow in your conduct speedily.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: She is desperate here; a peevish self-wind harlotry,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: one that no persuasion can do good upon.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: I understand thy looks: that pretty Welsh

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Which thou pour'st down from these swelling heavens

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: I am too perfect in; and, but for shame,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: In such a parley should I answer thee.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: I understand thy kisses and thou mine,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: And that's a feeling disputation:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: But I will never be a truant, love,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Till I have learned thy language; for thy tongue

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Makes Welsh as sweet as ditties highly penn'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: Sung by a fair queen in a summer's bower,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: With ravishing division, to her lute.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Nay, if you melt, then will she run mad.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: O, I am ignorance itself in this!

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: She bids you on the wanton rushes lay you down

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And rest your gentle head upon her lap,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And she will sing the song that pleaseth you

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And on your eyelids crown the god of sleep.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Charming your blood with pleasing heaviness,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Making such difference 'twixt wake and sleep

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: As is the difference betwixt day and night

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: The hour before the heavenly-harness'd team

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Begins his golden progress in the east.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: With all my heart I'll sit and hear her sing:

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: By that time will our book, I think, be drawn

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Do so;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And those musicians that shall play to you

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Hang in the air a thousand leagues from hence,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And straight they shall be here: sit, and attend.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Come, Kate, thou art perfect in lying down: come,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: quick, quick, that I may lay my head in thy lap.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: Go, ye giddy goose.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Now I perceive the devil understands Welsh;

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And 'tis no marvel he is so humorous.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: By'r lady, he is a good musician.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: Then should you be nothing but musical for you are

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: altogether governed by humours. Lie still, ye thief,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: and hear the lady sing in Welsh.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I had rather hear Lady, my brach, howl in Irish.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: Wouldst thou have thy head broken?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: No.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: Then be still.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Neither;'tis a woman's fault.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: Now God help thee!

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: To the Welsh lady's bed.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: What's that?

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Peace! she sings.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Come, Kate, I'll have your song too.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: Not mine, in good sooth.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Not yours, in good sooth! Heart! you swear like a

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: comfit-maker's wife. 'Not you, in good sooth,' and

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: 'as true as I live,' and 'as God shall mend me,' and

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: 'as sure as day,'

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And givest such sarcenet surety for thy oaths,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: As if thou never walk'st further than Finsbury.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Swear me, Kate, like a lady as thou art,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: A good mouth-filling oath, and leave 'in sooth,'

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And such protest of pepper-gingerbread,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: To velvet-guards and Sunday-citizens.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Come, sing.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: LADY PERCY
line: I will not sing.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: 'Tis the next way to turn tailor, or be red-breast

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: teacher. An the indentures be drawn, I'll away

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: within these two hours; and so, come in when ye will.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: Come, come, Lord Mortimer; you are as slow

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: As hot Lord Percy is on fire to go.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: By this our book is drawn; we'll but seal,

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: GLENDOWER
line: And then to horse immediately.

scene: SCENE I.  Bangor. The Archdeacon's house.
speaker: MORTIMER
line: With all my heart.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Lords, give us leave; the Prince of Wales and I

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Must have some private conference; but be near at hand,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For we shall presently have need of you.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I know not whether God will have it so,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For some displeasing service I have done,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That, in his secret doom, out of my blood

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: He'll breed revengement and a scourge for me;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But thou dost in thy passages of life

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Make me believe that thou art only mark'd

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For the hot vengeance and the rod of heaven

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To punish my mistreadings. Tell me else,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Could such inordinate and low desires,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Such poor, such bare, such lewd, such mean attempts,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Such barren pleasures, rude society,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: As thou art match'd withal and grafted to,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Accompany the greatness of thy blood

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And hold their level with thy princely heart?

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: So please your majesty, I would I could

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Quit all offences with as clear excuse

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: As well as I am doubtless I can purge

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Myself of many I am charged withal:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Yet such extenuation let me beg,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: As, in reproof of many tales devised,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: which oft the ear of greatness needs must hear,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: By smiling pick-thanks and base news-mongers,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I may, for some things true, wherein my youth

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Hath faulty wander'd and irregular,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Find pardon on my true submission.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: God pardon thee! yet let me wonder, Harry,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: At thy affections, which do hold a wing

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Quite from the flight of all thy ancestors.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thy place in council thou hast rudely lost.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Which by thy younger brother is supplied,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And art almost an alien to the hearts

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Of all the court and princes of my blood:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The hope and expectation of thy time

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Is ruin'd, and the soul of every man

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Prophetically doth forethink thy fall.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Had I so lavish of my presence been,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So common-hackney'd in the eyes of men,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So stale and cheap to vulgar company,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Opinion, that did help me to the crown,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Had still kept loyal to possession

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And left me in reputeless banishment,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: A fellow of no mark nor likelihood.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: By being seldom seen, I could not stir

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But like a comet I was wonder'd at;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That men would tell their children 'This is he;'

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Others would say 'Where, which is Bolingbroke?'

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And then I stole all courtesy from heaven,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And dress'd myself in such humility

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That I did pluck allegiance from men's hearts,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Loud shouts and salutations from their mouths,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Even in the presence of the crowned king.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thus did I keep my person fresh and new;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: My presence, like a robe pontifical,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Ne'er seen but wonder'd at: and so my state,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Seldom but sumptuous, showed like a feast

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And won by rareness such solemnity.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The skipping king, he ambled up and down

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With shallow jesters and rash bavin wits,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Soon kindled and soon burnt; carded his state,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Mingled his royalty with capering fools,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Had his great name profaned with their scorns

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And gave his countenance, against his name,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To laugh at gibing boys and stand the push

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Of every beardless vain comparative,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Grew a companion to the common streets,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Enfeoff'd himself to popularity;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That, being daily swallow'd by men's eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: They surfeited with honey and began

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To loathe the taste of sweetness, whereof a little

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: More than a little is by much too much.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So when he had occasion to be seen,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: He was but as the cuckoo is in June,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Heard, not regarded; seen, but with such eyes

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: As, sick and blunted with community,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Afford no extraordinary gaze,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Such as is bent on sun-like majesty

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: When it shines seldom in admiring eyes;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But rather drowzed and hung their eyelids down,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Slept in his face and render'd such aspect

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: As cloudy men use to their adversaries,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Being with his presence glutted, gorged and full.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And in that very line, Harry, standest thou;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For thou has lost thy princely privilege

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With vile participation: not an eye

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But is a-weary of thy common sight,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Save mine, which hath desired to see thee more;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Which now doth that I would not have it do,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Make blind itself with foolish tenderness.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I shall hereafter, my thrice gracious lord,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Be more myself.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For all the world

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: As thou art to this hour was Richard then

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: When I from France set foot at Ravenspurgh,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And even as I was then is Percy now.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Now, by my sceptre and my soul to boot,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: He hath more worthy interest to the state

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Than thou the shadow of succession;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For of no right, nor colour like to right,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: He doth fill fields with harness in the realm,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Turns head against the lion's armed jaws,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And, being no more in debt to years than thou,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Leads ancient lords and reverend bishops on

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To bloody battles and to bruising arms.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: What never-dying honour hath he got

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Against renowned Douglas! whose high deeds,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Whose hot incursions and great name in arms

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Holds from all soldiers chief majority

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And military title capital

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Through all the kingdoms that acknowledge Christ:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thrice hath this Hotspur, Mars in swathling clothes,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: This infant warrior, in his enterprises

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Discomfited great Douglas, ta'en him once,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Enlarged him and made a friend of him,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To fill the mouth of deep defiance up

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And shake the peace and safety of our throne.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And what say you to this? Percy, Northumberland,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The Archbishop's grace of York, Douglas, Mortimer,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Capitulate against us and are up.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But wherefore do I tell these news to thee?

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Why, Harry, do I tell thee of my foes,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Which art my near'st and dearest enemy?

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou that art like enough, through vassal fear,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Base inclination and the start of spleen

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To fight against me under Percy's pay,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To dog his heels and curtsy at his frowns,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To show how much thou art degenerate.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Do not think so; you shall not find it so:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And God forgive them that so much have sway'd

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Your majesty's good thoughts away from me!

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I will redeem all this on Percy's head

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And in the closing of some glorious day

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Be bold to tell you that I am your son;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: When I will wear a garment all of blood

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And stain my favours in a bloody mask,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which, wash'd away, shall scour my shame with it:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And that shall be the day, whene'er it lights,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That this same child of honour and renown,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This gallant Hotspur, this all-praised knight,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And your unthought-of Harry chance to meet.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: For every honour sitting on his helm,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Would they were multitudes, and on my head

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: My shames redoubled! for the time will come,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That I shall make this northern youth exchange

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: His glorious deeds for my indignities.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Percy is but my factor, good my lord,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: To engross up glorious deeds on my behalf;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And I will call him to so strict account,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That he shall render every glory up,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Yea, even the slightest worship of his time,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Or I will tear the reckoning from his heart.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This, in the name of God, I promise here:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The which if He be pleased I shall perform,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I do beseech your majesty may salve

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The long-grown wounds of my intemperance:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: If not, the end of life cancels all bands;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And I will die a hundred thousand deaths

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Ere break the smallest parcel of this vow.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: A hundred thousand rebels die in this:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou shalt have charge and sovereign trust herein.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How now, good Blunt? thy looks are full of speed.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: So hath the business that I come to speak of.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: Lord Mortimer of Scotland hath sent word

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: That Douglas and the English rebels met

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: The eleventh of this month at Shrewsbury

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: A mighty and a fearful head they are,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: If promises be kept on every hand,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: As ever offer'd foul play in the state.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The Earl of Westmoreland set forth to-day;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With him my son, Lord John of Lancaster;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For this advertisement is five days old:

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: On Wednesday next, Harry, you shall set forward;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: On Thursday we ourselves will march: our meeting

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Is Bridgenorth: and, Harry, you shall march

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Through Gloucestershire; by which account,

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Our business valued, some twelve days hence

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Our general forces at Bridgenorth shall meet.

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Our hands are full of business: let's away;

scene: SCENE II.  London. The palace.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Advantage feeds him fat, while men delay.

line: skin hangs about me like an like an old lady's loose

line: gown; I am withered like an old apple-john. Well,

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.

line: Go bear this letter to Lord John of Lancaster, to my

line: brother John; this to my Lord of Westmoreland.

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.

line: Go, Peto, to horse, to horse; for thou and I have

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: thirty miles to ride yet ere dinner time.

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.

line: Jack, meet me to-morrow in the temple hall at two

line: o'clock in the afternoon.

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: There shalt thou know thy charge; and there receive

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.

line: Money and order for their furniture.

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The land is burning; Percy stands on high;

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And either we or they must lower lie.

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.

scene: Scene III  Eastcheap. The Boar's-Head Tavern.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: O, I could wish this tavern were my drum!

line: Because the king is certainly possess'd

line: A perilous gash, a very limb lopp'd off:

line: If that the devil and mischance look big

speaker: HOTSPUR
