line: I hope no less, yet needful 'tis to fear;

scene: SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.
speaker: ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
line: And, to prevent the worst, Sir Michael, speed:

scene: SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.
speaker: ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
line: For if Lord Percy thrive not, ere the king

scene: SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.
speaker: ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
line: Dismiss his power, he means to visit us,

scene: SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.
speaker: ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
line: For he hath heard of our confederacy,

scene: SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.
speaker: ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
line: And 'tis but wisdom to make strong against him:

scene: SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.
speaker: ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
line: Therefore make haste. I must go write again

scene: SCENE IV.  York. The ARCHBISHOP'S palace.
speaker: ARCHBISHOP OF YORK
line: To other friends; and so farewell, Sir Michael.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How bloodily the sun begins to peer

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Above yon busky hill! the day looks pale

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: At his distemperature.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The southern wind

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Doth play the trumpet to his purposes,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And by his hollow whistling in the leaves

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Foretells a tempest and a blustering day.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Then with the losers let it sympathize,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For nothing can seem foul to those that win.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How now, my Lord of Worcester! 'tis not well

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That you and I should meet upon such terms

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: As now we meet. You have deceived our trust,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And made us doff our easy robes of peace,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To crush our old limbs in ungentle steel:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: This is not well, my lord, this is not well.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: What say you to it? will you again unknit

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: This curlish knot of all-abhorred war?

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And move in that obedient orb again

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Where you did give a fair and natural light,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And be no more an exhaled meteor,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: A prodigy of fear and a portent

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Of broached mischief to the unborn times?

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Hear me, my liege:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: For mine own part, I could be well content

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: To entertain the lag-end of my life

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: With quiet hours; for I do protest,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: I have not sought the day of this dislike.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: You have not sought it! how comes it, then?

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Rebellion lay in his way, and he found it.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Peace, chewet, peace!

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: It pleased your majesty to turn your looks

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Of favour from myself and all our house;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And yet I must remember you, my lord,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: We were the first and dearest of your friends.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: For you my staff of office did I break

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: In Richard's time; and posted day and night

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: to meet you on the way, and kiss your hand,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: When yet you were in place and in account

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Nothing so strong and fortunate as I.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: It was myself, my brother and his son,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: That brought you home and boldly did outdare

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The dangers of the time. You swore to us,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And you did swear that oath at Doncaster,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: That you did nothing purpose 'gainst the state;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Nor claim no further than your new-fall'n right,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The seat of Gaunt, dukedom of Lancaster:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: To this we swore our aid. But in short space

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: It rain'd down fortune showering on your head;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And such a flood of greatness fell on you,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: What with our help, what with the absent king,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: What with the injuries of a wanton time,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The seeming sufferances that you had borne,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And the contrarious winds that held the king

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: So long in his unlucky Irish wars

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: That all in England did repute him dead:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And from this swarm of fair advantages

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: You took occasion to be quickly woo'd

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: To gripe the general sway into your hand;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Forget your oath to us at Doncaster;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And being fed by us you used us so

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: As that ungentle hull, the cuckoo's bird,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Useth the sparrow; did oppress our nest;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Grew by our feeding to so great a bulk

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: That even our love durst not come near your sight

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: For fear of swallowing; but with nimble wing

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: We were enforced, for safety sake, to fly

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Out of sight and raise this present head;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Whereby we stand opposed by such means

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: As you yourself have forged against yourself

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: By unkind usage, dangerous countenance,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And violation of all faith and troth

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Sworn to us in your younger enterprise.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: These things indeed you have articulate,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Proclaim'd at market-crosses, read in churches,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To face the garment of rebellion

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With some fine colour that may please the eye

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Of fickle changelings and poor discontents,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Which gape and rub the elbow at the news

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Of hurlyburly innovation:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And never yet did insurrection want

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Such water-colours to impaint his cause;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Nor moody beggars, starving for a time

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Of pellmell havoc and confusion.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: In both your armies there is many a soul

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Shall pay full dearly for this encounter,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: If once they join in trial. Tell your nephew,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The Prince of Wales doth join with all the world

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: In praise of Henry Percy: by my hopes,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This present enterprise set off his head,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I do not think a braver gentleman,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: More active-valiant or more valiant-young,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: More daring or more bold, is now alive

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: To grace this latter age with noble deeds.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: For my part, I may speak it to my shame,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I have a truant been to chivalry;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And so I hear he doth account me too;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Yet this before my father's majesty--

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I am content that he shall take the odds

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Of his great name and estimation,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And will, to save the blood on either side,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Try fortune with him in a single fight.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And, Prince of Wales, so dare we venture thee,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Albeit considerations infinite

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Do make against it. No, good Worcester, no,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: We love our people well; even those we love

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: That are misled upon your cousin's part;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And, will they take the offer of our grace,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Both he and they and you, every man

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Shall be my friend again and I'll be his:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So tell your cousin, and bring me word

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: What he will do: but if he will not yield,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Rebuke and dread correction wait on us

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And they shall do their office. So, be gone;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: We will not now be troubled with reply:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: We offer fair; take it advisedly.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: It will not be accepted, on my life:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The Douglas and the Hotspur both together

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Are confident against the world in arms.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Hence, therefore, every leader to his charge;

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: For, on their answer, will we set on them:

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And God befriend us, as our cause is just!

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Hal, if thou see me down in the battle and bestride

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: me, so; 'tis a point of friendship.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Nothing but a colossus can do thee that friendship.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Say thy prayers, and farewell.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I  would 'twere bed-time, Hal, and all well.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Why, thou owest God a death.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: 'Tis not due yet; I would be loath to pay him before

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: his day. What need I be so forward with him that

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: calls not on me? Well, 'tis no matter; honour pricks

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: me on. Yea, but how if honour prick me off when I

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: come on? how then? Can honour set to a leg? no: or

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: an arm? no: or take away the grief of a wound? no.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Honour hath no skill in surgery, then? no. What is

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: honour? a word. What is in that word honour? what

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: is that honour? air. A trim reckoning! Who hath it?

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: he that died o' Wednesday. Doth he feel it? no.

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Doth he hear it? no. 'Tis insensible, then. Yea,

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: to the dead. But will it not live with the living?

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: no. Why? detraction will not suffer it. Therefore

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I'll none of it. Honour is a mere scutcheon: and so

scene: SCENE I.  KING HENRY IV's camp near Shrewsbury.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: ends my catechism.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: O, no, my nephew must not know, Sir Richard,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The liberal and kind offer of the king.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: 'Twere best he did.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Then are we all undone.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: It is not possible, it cannot be,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The king should keep his word in loving us;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: He will suspect us still and find a time

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: To punish this offence in other faults:

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Suspicion all our lives shall be stuck full of eyes;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: For treason is but trusted like the fox,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Who, ne'er so tame, so cherish'd and lock'd up,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Will have a wild trick of his ancestors.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Look how we can, or sad or merrily,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Interpretation will misquote our looks,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And we shall feed like oxen at a stall,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The better cherish'd, still the nearer death.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: My nephew's trespass may be well forgot;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: it hath the excuse of youth and heat of blood,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And an adopted name of privilege,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: A hair-brain'd Hotspur, govern'd by a spleen:

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: All his offences live upon my head

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And on his father's; we did train him on,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And, his corruption being ta'en from us,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: We, as the spring of all, shall pay for all.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Therefore, good cousin, let not Harry know,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: In any case, the offer of the king.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Deliver what you will; I'll say 'tis so.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Here comes your cousin.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: My uncle is return'd:

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Deliver up my Lord of Westmoreland.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Uncle, what news?

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The king will bid you battle presently.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Defy him by the Lord of Westmoreland.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Lord Douglas, go you and tell him so.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Marry, and shall, and very willingly.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: There is no seeming mercy in the king.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Did you beg any? God forbid!

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: I told him gently of our grievances,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Of his oath-breaking; which he mended thus,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: By now forswearing that he is forsworn:

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: He calls us rebels, traitors; and will scourge

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: With haughty arms this hateful name in us.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Arm, gentlemen; to arms! for I have thrown

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: A brave defiance in King Henry's teeth,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: And Westmoreland, that was engaged, did bear it;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Which cannot choose but bring him quickly on.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: The Prince of Wales stepp'd forth before the king,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And, nephew, challenged you to single fight.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: O, would the quarrel lay upon our heads,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And that no man might draw short breath today

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: But I and Harry Monmouth! Tell me, tell me,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: How show'd his tasking? seem'd it in contempt?

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: No, by my soul; I never in my life

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Did hear a challenge urged more modestly,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Unless a brother should a brother dare

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: To gentle exercise and proof of arms.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: He gave you all the duties of a man;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Trimm'd up your praises with a princely tongue,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Spoke to your deservings like a chronicle,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Making you ever better than his praise

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: By still dispraising praise valued in you;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: And, which became him like a prince indeed,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: He made a blushing cital of himself;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: And chid his truant youth with such a grace

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: As if he master'd there a double spirit.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: Of teaching and of learning instantly.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: There did he pause: but let me tell the world,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: If he outlive the envy of this day,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: England did never owe so sweet a hope,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: VERNON
line: So much misconstrued in his wantonness.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Cousin, I think thou art enamoured

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: On his follies: never did I hear

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Of any prince so wild a libertine.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: But be he as he will, yet once ere night

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I will embrace him with a soldier's arm,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: That he shall shrink under my courtesy.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Arm, arm with speed: and, fellows, soldiers, friends,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Better consider what you have to do

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Than I, that have not well the gift of tongue,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Can lift your blood up with persuasion.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: Messenger
line: My lord, here are letters for you.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I cannot read them now.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: O gentlemen, the time of life is short!

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: To spend that shortness basely were too long,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: If life did ride upon a dial's point,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Still ending at the arrival of an hour.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: An if we live, we live to tread on kings;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: If die, brave death, when princes die with us!

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Now, for our consciences, the arms are fair,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: When the intent of bearing them is just.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: Messenger
line: My lord, prepare; the king comes on apace.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I thank him, that he cuts me from my tale,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: For I profess not talking; only this--

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Let each man do his best: and here draw I

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: A sword, whose temper I intend to stain

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: With the best blood that I can meet withal

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: In the adventure of this perilous day.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Now, Esperance! Percy! and set on.

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Sound all the lofty instruments of war,

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And by that music let us all embrace;

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: For, heaven to earth, some of us never shall

scene: SCENE II.  The rebel camp.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: A second time do such a courtesy.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: What is thy name, that in the battle thus

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: Thou crossest me? what honour dost thou seek

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: Upon my head?

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Know then, my name is Douglas;

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: And I do haunt thee in the battle thus

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Because some tell me that thou art a king.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: They tell thee true.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: The Lord of Stafford dear to-day hath bought

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Thy likeness, for instead of thee, King Harry,

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: This sword hath ended him: so shall it thee,

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Unless thou yield thee as my prisoner.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: I was not born a yielder, thou proud Scot;

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: And thou shalt find a king that will revenge

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: SIR WALTER BLUNT
line: Lord Stafford's death.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: O Douglas, hadst thou fought at Holmedon thus,

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: never had triumph'd upon a Scot.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: All's done, all's won; here breathless lies the king.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Where?

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Here.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: This, Douglas? no: I know this face full well:

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: A gallant knight he was, his name was Blunt;

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Semblably furnish'd like the king himself.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: A fool go with thy soul, whither it goes!

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: A borrow'd title hast thou bought too dear:

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Why didst thou tell me that thou wert a king?

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: The king hath many marching in his coats.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Now, by my sword, I will kill all his coats;

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: I'll murder all his wardrobe, piece by piece,

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Until I meet the king.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Up, and away!

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Our soldiers stand full fairly for the day.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Though I could 'scape shot-free at London, I fear

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: the shot here; here's no scoring but upon the pate.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Soft! who are you? Sir Walter Blunt: there's honour

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: for you! here's no vanity! I am as hot as moulten

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: lead, and as heavy too: God keep lead out of me! I

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: need no more weight than mine own bowels. I have

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: led my ragamuffins where they are peppered: there's

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: not three of my hundred and fifty left alive; and

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: they are for the town's end, to beg during life.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: But who comes here?

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What, stand'st thou idle here? lend me thy sword:

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Many a nobleman lies stark and stiff

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Under the hoofs of vaunting enemies,

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Whose deaths are yet unrevenged: I prithee,

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: lend me thy sword.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: O Hal, I prithee, give me leave to breathe awhile.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Turk Gregory never did such deeds in arms as I have

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: done this day. I have paid Percy, I have made him sure.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: He is, indeed; and living to kill thee. I prithee,

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: lend me thy sword.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Nay, before God, Hal, if Percy be alive, thou get'st

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: not my sword; but take my pistol, if thou wilt.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Give it to me: what, is it in the case?

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Ay, Hal; 'tis hot, 'tis hot; there's that will sack a city.

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What, is it a time to jest and dally now?

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Well, if Percy be alive, I'll pierce him. If he do

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: come in my way, so: if he do not, if I come in his

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: willingly, let him make a carbonado of me. I like

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: not such grinning honour as Sir Walter hath: give me

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: life: which if I can save, so; if not, honour comes

scene: SCENE III.  Plain between the camps.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: unlooked for, and there's an end.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I prithee,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Harry, withdraw thyself; thou bleed'st too much.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Lord John of Lancaster, go you with him.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Not I, my lord, unless I did bleed too.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I beseech your majesty, make up,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Lest your retirement do amaze your friends.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I will do so.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: My Lord of Westmoreland, lead him to his tent.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: WESTMORELAND
line: Come, my lord, I'll lead you to your tent.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Lead me, my lord? I do not need your help:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And God forbid a shallow scratch should drive

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The Prince of Wales from such a field as this,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Where stain'd nobility lies trodden on,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: and rebels' arms triumph in massacres!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: We breathe too long: come, cousin Westmoreland,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Our duty this way lies; for God's sake come.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: By God, thou hast deceived me, Lancaster;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I did not think thee lord of such a spirit:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Before, I loved thee as a brother, John;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: But now, I do respect thee as my soul.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I saw him hold Lord Percy at the point

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With lustier maintenance than I did look for

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Of such an ungrown warrior.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O, this boy

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Lends mettle to us all!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: Another king! they grow like Hydra's heads:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: I am the Douglas, fatal to all those

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: That wear those colours on them: what art thou,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: That counterfeit'st the person of a king?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: The king himself; who, Douglas, grieves at heart

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: So many of his shadows thou hast met

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And not the very king. I have two boys

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Seek Percy and thyself about the field:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: But, seeing thou fall'st on me so luckily,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: I will assay thee: so, defend thyself.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: I fear thou art another counterfeit;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: And yet, in faith, thou bear'st thee like a king:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: But mine I am sure thou art, whoe'er thou be,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF DOUGLAS
line: And thus I win thee.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Hold up thy head, vile Scot, or thou art like

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Never to hold it up again! the spirits

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Of valiant Shirley, Stafford, Blunt, are in my arms:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: It is the Prince of Wales that threatens thee;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Who never promiseth but he means to pay.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Cheerly, my lord how fares your grace?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Sir Nicholas Gawsey hath for succor sent,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And so hath Clifton: I'll to Clifton straight.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Stay, and breathe awhile:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thou hast redeem'd thy lost opinion,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And show'd thou makest some tender of my life,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: In this fair rescue thou hast brought to me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O God! they did me too much injury

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That ever said I hearken'd for your death.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: If it were so, I might have let alone

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The insulting hand of Douglas over you,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Which would have been as speedy in your end

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: As all the poisonous potions in the world

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And saved the treacherous labour of your son.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Make up to Clifton: I'll to Sir Nicholas Gawsey.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: If I mistake not, thou art Harry Monmouth.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Thou speak'st as if I would deny my name.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: My name is Harry Percy.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Why, then I see

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: A very valiant rebel of the name.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I am the Prince of Wales; and think not, Percy,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: To share with me in glory any more:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Two stars keep not their motion in one sphere;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Nor can one England brook a double reign,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Of Harry Percy and the Prince of Wales.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Nor shall it, Harry; for the hour is come

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: To end the one of us; and would to God

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Thy name in arms were now as great as mine!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I'll make it greater ere I part from thee;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And all the budding honours on thy crest

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I'll crop, to make a garland for my head.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I can no longer brook thy vanities.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Well said, Hal! to it Hal! Nay, you shall find no

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: boy's play here, I can tell you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: O, Harry, thou hast robb'd me of my youth!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: I better brook the loss of brittle life

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Than those proud titles thou hast won of me;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: They wound my thoughts worse than sword my flesh:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: But thought's the slave of life, and life time's fool;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And time, that takes survey of all the world,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Must have a stop. O, I could prophesy,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: But that the earthy and cold hand of death

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: Lies on my tongue: no, Percy, thou art dust

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: HOTSPUR
line: And food for--

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: For worms, brave Percy: fare thee well, great heart!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Ill-weaved ambition, how much art thou shrunk!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: When that this body did contain a spirit,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: A kingdom for it was too small a bound;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: But now two paces of the vilest earth

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Is room enough: this earth that bears thee dead

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Bears not alive so stout a gentleman.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: If thou wert sensible of courtesy,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I should not make so dear a show of zeal:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: But let my favours hide thy mangled face;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And, even in thy behalf, I'll thank myself

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: For doing these fair rites of tenderness.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Adieu, and take thy praise with thee to heaven!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Thy ignominy sleep with thee in the grave,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: But not remember'd in thy epitaph!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: What, old acquaintance! could not all this flesh

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Keep in a little life? Poor Jack, farewell!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I could have better spared a better man:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: O, I should have a heavy miss of thee,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: If I were much in love with vanity!

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Death hath not struck so fat a deer to-day,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Though many dearer, in this bloody fray.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Embowell'd will I see thee by and by:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Till then in blood by noble Percy lie.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Rising up  Embowelled! if thou embowel me to-day,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I'll give you leave to powder me and eat me too

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: to-morrow. 'Sblood,'twas time to counterfeit, or

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: that hot termagant Scot had paid me scot and lot too.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Counterfeit? I lie, I am no counterfeit: to die,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: is to be a counterfeit; for he is but the

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: counterfeit of a man who hath not the life of a man:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: but to counterfeit dying, when a man thereby

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: liveth, is to be no counterfeit, but the true and

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: perfect image of life indeed. The better part of

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: valour is discretion; in the which better part I

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: have saved my life.'Zounds, I am afraid of this

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: gunpowder Percy, though he be dead: how, if he

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: should counterfeit too and rise? by my faith, I am

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: afraid he would prove the better counterfeit.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Therefore I'll make him sure; yea, and I'll swear I

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: killed him. Why may not he rise as well as I?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Nothing confutes me but eyes, and nobody sees me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Therefore, sirrah,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: with a new wound in your thigh, come you along with me.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Come, brother John; full bravely hast thou flesh'd

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Thy maiden sword.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: But, soft! whom have we here?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Did you not tell me this fat man was dead?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I did; I saw him dead,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Breathless and bleeding on the ground. Art

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: thou alive?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Or is it fantasy that plays upon our eyesight?

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I prithee, speak; we will not trust our eyes

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Without our ears: thou art not what thou seem'st.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: No, that's certain; I am not a double man: but if I

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: be not Jack Falstaff, then am I a Jack. There is Percy:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: if your father will do me any honour, so; if not, let

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: him kill the next Percy himself. I look to be either

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: earl or duke, I can assure you.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Why, Percy I killed myself and saw thee dead.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: Didst thou? Lord, Lord, how this world is given to

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: lying! I grant you I was down and out of breath;

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: and so was he: but we rose both at an instant and

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: fought a long hour by Shrewsbury clock. If I may be

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: believed, so; if not, let them that should reward

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: valour bear the sin upon their own heads. I'll take

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: it upon my death, I gave him this wound in the

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: thigh: if the man were alive and would deny it,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: 'zounds, I would make him eat a piece of my sword.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: This is the strangest tale that ever I heard.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This is the strangest fellow, brother John.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Come, bring your luggage nobly on your back:

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: For my part, if a lie may do thee grace,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I'll gild it with the happiest terms I have.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The trumpet sounds retreat; the day is ours.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Come, brother, let us to the highest of the field,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: To see what friends are living, who are dead.

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I'll follow, as they say, for reward. He that

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: rewards me, God reward him! If I do grow great,

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: I'll grow less; for I'll purge, and leave sack, and

scene: SCENE IV.  Another part of the field.
speaker: FALSTAFF
line: live cleanly as a nobleman should do.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Thus ever did rebellion find rebuke.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Ill-spirited Worcester! did not we send grace,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Pardon and terms of love to all of you?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And wouldst thou turn our offers contrary?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Misuse the tenor of thy kinsman's trust?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Three knights upon our party slain to-day,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: A noble earl and many a creature else

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Had been alive this hour,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: If like a Christian thou hadst truly borne

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Betwixt our armies true intelligence.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: What I have done my safety urged me to;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: And I embrace this fortune patiently,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: EARL OF WORCESTER
line: Since not to be avoided it falls on me.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Bear Worcester to the death and Vernon too:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Other offenders we will pause upon.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: How goes the field?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The noble Scot, Lord Douglas, when he saw

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The fortune of the day quite turn'd from him,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The noble Percy slain, and all his men

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Upon the foot of fear, fled with the rest;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: And falling from a hill, he was so bruised

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: That the pursuers took him. At my tent

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: The Douglas is; and I beseech your grace

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: I may dispose of him.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: With all my heart.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Then, brother John of Lancaster, to you

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: This honourable bounty shall belong:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Go to the Douglas, and deliver him

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Up to his pleasure, ransomless and free:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: His valour shown upon our crests to-day

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Hath taught us how to cherish such high deeds

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: PRINCE HENRY
line: Even in the bosom of our adversaries.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: I thank your grace for this high courtesy,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: LANCASTER
line: Which I shall give away immediately.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Then this remains, that we divide our power.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: You, son John, and my cousin Westmoreland

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Towards York shall bend you with your dearest speed,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To meet Northumberland and the prelate Scroop,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Who, as we hear, are busily in arms:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Myself and you, son Harry, will towards Wales,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: To fight with Glendower and the Earl of March.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Rebellion in this land shall lose his sway,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Meeting the cheque of such another day:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: And since this business so fair is done,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the field.
speaker: KING HENRY IV
line: Let us not leave till all our own be won.
